etymologies: mid 19th century. Probably from German Ambulatorium outpatients' department from post-classical Latin ambulatorium; use of the German word in the medical sense is probably after post-classical Latin clinicum ambulatorium

definitions: A clinic providing outpatient treatment or primary care.

notes.text: Originally used in German contexts, later often in relation to the Soviet Union. The term is not used of such clinics in the English-speaking world.
